versionHistory.releaseNotes: Fixed the crashing on iOS6 and iOS7
Minor bug fixes and a confirmation before you delete a recording

Version 3.0 is TapeACall's biggest update yet!

* We've completely redesigned the app for iOS 7 with a new minimal flat interface that we think you'll love!
* Quickly jump forward or backwards 15 seconds when playing a recording
* Listen to your recordings at 1.25x, 1.5x, and 2x playback speeds to save time
* Now available in Russia, Thailand, Costa Rica and the Ukraine!
* Now translated to Russian, Thai and Simplified Chinese

We've partnered with Rev.com so you can easily convert your TapeACall recordings into high quality, highly accurate text. Rev.com is a leader in audio transcriptions.

You can now label recordings using any keyboard you have enabled on your phone such as Hebrew, Arabic, and Emoji.
When uploading to Dropbox, Drive, or Evernote, the app will prefill the filename textbox with the recordings label.

- Tapping on the top of the recordings screen will scroll to the top of your recordings
- Bug Fixes

What would you like to see in our next update?  Tweet @tapeacall

1. Updated the look and feel of the recordings screen.

2. Fixed a bug that prevented some users from uploading recordings to Dropbox.

3. When you upload a recording to Google Drive, the filename will now include mp3 at the end.

This update fixes the bug that was causing the app to crash for some users when opening the app and/or activating.

We remade the tutorial video to show a more efficient and overall better way to begin recording a phone call with the app.

This update is STRONGLY recommended!

Thank you to everyone who rated the app and left a review. We read all your suggestions and we're pleased to present some awesome new features! 

1. We want to offer a tip to speed up the recording process for users on Verizon and Sprint.  Our tutorial video tells you to place a call to someone, then open TapeACall and press record.  Its actually must faster to open TapeACall and begin recording, then place a call to someone and merge the calls.  Basically do it the other way around and you will skip the 30 second delay.

2. Google Drive support! You can now upload your recordings to Google Drive in 1 click.

3. Evernote support! You can now upload your recordings to Evernote in 1 click.

4. Made some changes to how the app dials the access number for users in certain countries.  The app will attempt to dial the number as it should be dialed from a mobile phone.

Thank you to everyone who rated the app and left a review.  We read all your suggestions and we're pleased to present some awesome new features!

1. Dropbox support! You can now upload your recordings to Dropbox in 1 click.  We made it as simple as possible.

2. You now have the option to attach the recording to an email, or just mail a link to the recording.

3. When you share a recording via email, the app will show you how many megabytes the recording is.  If the recording is over 10 megabytes, or you have a poor internet connection, we recommend you just send a link and download the recording from our website.

4. You can now edit how the app dials the access number.  If you need to remove the country code, or add a carrier code, just go to the settings screen and tap "Access Number"

5. Translated the app into 11 new languages*.  You can manually change the language by opening your iPhone settings app, scrolling down to TapeACall, then selecting "Language"

* Arabic, Bulgarian, Estonian, Finnish, German, Latvian, Lithuanian, Norwegian (bokmål), Romanian, Slovak, Slovenian

√ Based on your App Store reviews, we have changed what you hear when you dial the access number.  Instead of hearing "Recording... BEEEEEEP..." you'll just hear a very short beep.
√ Based on your App Store reviews, you can now listen to your recordings in the background.  This means you can still hear them when your screen is locked, or while you use other apps.
√ Based on your App Store reviews, If we have multiple access numbers in your country, the app will prompt you to select one.  Our apologies to our Canadian users who might have had a non-local access number selected by default.
√ Fixed a bug where the app wouldn't display any text if the app wasn't translated in your language
√ Fixed an issue where sometimes you have to press the record button multiple times for the app to dial the access number.
√ Thank you to everyone who submitted crash reports.  We fixed numerous crashes.
√ Translated the app into Danish

We are 100% dedicated to providing you with the best possible call recording app.  We read every single App Store review, and we are active on Facebook and Twitter.  If you reach out to us with suggestions, we will make it happen!

✔ We added a video that shows how to use the app and record your calls
✔ Recordings can now be heard even if you have your ringer on silent
✔ App works in even more countries than ever before
✔ Added additional access numbers throughout Canada
✔ You can contact customer service from inside the app
✔ Translated the app into 16 different languages
✔ Dates and times are now formatted based on your country


🌍 Version 2.0 🌍

Based on your feedback, we've translated TapeACall into 16 different languages! We are committed to giving users around the world the best possible localized experience. If you find any text is poorly translated, please email us (support@tapeacall.com) and let us know! Supporting so many languages is new to us, but our goal is to have the highest quality call recording app available in the world.

description.standard:
TapeACall lets you record your iPhone's incoming and outgoing phone calls 

TapeACall, a #1 business app in The United States, Argentina, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Denmark, Chile, Croatia, Czech Republic, Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Estonia, Finland, France, Hong Kong, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Panama, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Spain, and Sweden!

TONS OF EXTRA FEATURES

√ Record your incoming calls 
√ Record your outgoing calls 
√ No limit on how long you can record a call for 
√ No limit on how many recordings you make 
√ No monthly, yearly or maintenance fees! 
√ Transfer recordings to your new devices 
√ Easily download recordings to your computer 
√ Upload your recordings to Dropbox! 
√ Upload your recordings to Evernote! 
√ Upload your recordings to Google Drive! 
√ Email recordings to yourself in MP3 format 
√ Share recordings via SMS, Facebook & Twitter 
√ Label recordings so you can easily find them 
√ Recordings available as soon as you hang up 
√ Play recordings in the background 
√ Access to call recording laws 
√ Beautiful easy to use interface 
√ Push notifications take you to the recording
√ Customer service with real humans 
√ Developers that care about their customers 
√ New features added all the time 
√ Powered by TelAPI

NOTE: TapeACall requires your carrier supports 3-way calling. SimpleTalk and H2o Wireless do NOT offer this in the US. 

Frequently Asked Questions
—————————————————————— 

How does this app record calls? 

Take a look at our screenshots for step by step instructions. 

When you're on a call and you want to record it, open TapeACall and press the record button. We will put your call on hold and dial our recording line. As soon as our line answers tap the merge button on your screen to create a 3 way call between your other caller and our recording line. 

If you want to record an outgoing call, just press the record button. The app will dial our recording line and will begin recording as soon as our line answers. Once that happens, tap the add call button on your screen, call the person you want to record, then press the merge button when they answer. 

—————————————————————— 

Can I download recordings to my computer? 

Yes, and we've made it extremely easy to do this. From inside the app you can attach the recording to an email and send it to yourself as an MP3, or you can click the share button and find a short URL that you can type into your computer's browser. 

—————————————————————— 

How many recordings can I make? 

As many as you want! We don't have a limit on the number of recordings you can make. 

—————————————————————— 

How long can a recording be? 

As long as you want! We don't have a limit on how long your recording can be. You can record for hours if you want.

—————————————————————— 

Are there any additional fees? 

We do NOT charge you any additional fees.  Please keep in mind that 3-way calling will use your airtime minutes. Also, carriers outside the US may charge for long distance calls, so be sure to check if TapeACall is long distance for you. If it is, you may be able to get around this by adding TapeACall's access number as one of your "Fav" numbers so you can call it without additional airtime usage or carriers fees. If we don't have an access number that is considered local by your carrier, please contact us and we'll try to get one for you!
